channel.title: When i compile i get 'javac' is not reconized as a internal
channel.description:
'javac' is not reconized as a internal or external command, opperable program or batch.
can some one help or explain to me wat this means exactly?
ty, ~Tim~

item.title: When i compile i get 'javac' is not reconized as a internal
item.dc:creator: @maxxy maxxy
item.description:
@maxxy wrote:

put this in your compiler:

@echo off
COLOR 09
title SERVERNAMEHERE Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

‘javac’ is not reconized as a internal or external command, opperable program or batch.

item.source: When i compile i get 'javac' is not reconized as a internal

item.title: When i compile i get 'javac' is not reconized as a internal
item.dc:creator: @Bacus23 Bacus23
item.description:
@Bacus23 wrote:

basically, javac stands for (java compiler) and javac compiles all your folders basically updating!

here edit your compile file and replace it with this:

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

then save…
compile…

and there u go

Read full topic
